pages.text: Hoppers use gravity to pull items. They can hold up to 5 stacks of items.$(br2)$(italics)This recipe has been changed from vanilla.

Tubes are a basic, but still useful, way of transporting items. Items flowing through a tube have a preference of which direction to go, following gravity. Tubes with over 16 items inside will break, so be careful.

Rolling Belts are another basic way of transporting items. Use an $(hammer) to change their direction. They will automatically insert into containers. Their speed is fixed, and they are most used in machinery.

Mechanical Belts are the best way of transporting items. Faster-moving belts will move items faster. $(ponder)$(br)See $(l:transportation/funnels_and_tunnels)Funnels and Tunnels$() for related blocks.

The chute transports items down, like hoppers, but they are cheaper to make en masse. They can also transport items straight up, but you'll need an $(l:kinetic_machines/encased_fan)Encased Fan$() under them. $(ponder)
